posts.post_content: So you can have a card called "Conquer" before you actually Conquer them, then call it foreshadowing and convince them to submit before you destroy them.
posts.html:
So you can have a card called "Conquer" before you actually Conquer them, then call it foreshadowing and convince them to submit before you destroy them.

Posted By: OpeeFomenom (9/29/2010 12:21:15 PM)
Rating:

@OpeeFornenom:
Even better, cast Conquer and follow-up by casting Foreshadow!

The card itself is mediocre at best though..sure there are (potentially) really good lands to steal, but if I was running a land destruction deck, i'd be destroying opponents lands, not taking them. Also in a LD deck, Plow Under fits the bill much better. Although you probably won't have any friends to play against after a couple of resolved Plow Under spells..and with good reason, that card is full of hatred.

Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (2/2/2012 12:58:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great idea for a card, but was just too expensive. 3R would have been fair and very useable.
  
   
@ Try4se - paying 5 mana to only be able to remove a land is just dumb. You might as well use [Craterize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craterize). Four mana would make it \*good\* but not overpowered.
  
   
And I don't think many people nowadays would complain that it's overpowered; this is an era where spoiled new players whine about [Fiery Hellhound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiery Hellhound) being too weak. That thing's a punisher.
posts.html:
Great idea for a card, but was just too expensive. 3R would have been fair and very useable.

@ Try4se - paying 5 mana to only be able to remove a land is just dumb. You might as well use Craterize. Four mana would make it *good* but not overpowered.

And I don't think many people nowadays would complain that it's overpowered; this is an era where spoiled new players whine about Fiery Hellhound being too weak. That thing's a punisher.
